prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation or translation. 1. Sketch phase: - Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane. - Draw a rectangle defined by the following vertices: (0,0), (0.5667, 0), (0.5667, 0.75), and (0, 0.75). These lines form loop 1 and face 1. 2. Scale the 2D sketch by 75%. 3. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 4. Extrude phase: - Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.025 units in the positive Z-direction. **Dimensions:** The prism has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.025 Part 2: Two Cylinders Construct two cylinders of equal height and diameter, positioned parallel to each other with a slight offset. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the specified translation and no rotation. 1. Sketch phase: - Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane. - Draw two circles centered at (0.0049, 0.0441) and (0.0051, 0.0049), each with a radius of 0.0049. These circles form loop 1 for face 1 and loop 1 for face 2. 2. Scale the 2D sketch by 4.9%. 3. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0552, 0.5787, 0.025] 4. Extrude phase: - Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0394 units in the negative Z-direction. **Dimensions:** Each cylinder has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.049 (approx.) - Width: 0.049 (approx.) - Height: 0.0394 (approx.)</description>
